intro: Allium paniculatum subsp. tenuiflorum, commonly known as narrowflower garlic, is a perennial bulbous plant native to Central Asia. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale purple flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild garlic flavor, making it a valuable addition to both culinary and ornamental gardens. It is also noted for its ability to naturalize and spread readily in suitable conditions.
